Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that both Obasanjo and Goodluck Jonathan were arrested by the EFCC.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or official reports to confirm the arrests of the former presidents.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the arrests were part of President Buhari's anti-corruption campaign without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no record of any former Nigerian head of state being arrested by the EFCC.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting unverified information and relying on social media posts without proper verification.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
